etymology.value: From Latin per- (thoroughly) + facere (to make, do).

verb_forms.present_indicative: perficio, perficis, perficit, perficimus, perficitis, perficiunt
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: perficiebam, perficiebas, perficiebat, perficiebamus, perficiebatis, perficiebant
verb_forms.future_indicative: perficiam, perficies, perficiet, perficiemus, perficietis, perficient
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: perfeci, perfecisti, perfecit, perfecimus, perfecistis, perfecerunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: perfeceram, perfeceras, perfecerat, perfeceramus, perfeceratis, perfecerant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: perfecero, perfeceris, perfecerit, perfecerimus, perfeceritis, perfecerint

usage_notes.explanation: Perficiere is a Latin verb meaning to complete, finish, accomplish, or perfect something. It implies bringing something to its full or desired state.
